r2dii.match 0.0.1

Source: vignettes/r2dii-match-0-0-1.Rmd
r2dii-match-0-0-1.Rmd

We’re happy to announce that r2dii.match is now on CRAN.

r2dii.match matches data from financial portfolios to asset level data from market-intelligence databases (e.g. power plant capacities, emission factors, etc.). This is the first step to assess if a financial portfolio aligns with climate goals. For details see the package’s website and https://2degrees-investing.org/.

Install r2dii.match with:

install.packages("r2dii.match")

And use it with:

library(r2dii.match)

match_name() matches a loanbook and asset-level dataset (ald). Let’s try it with demo datasets from the package r2dii.data.

# install.packages("r2dii.data")
library(r2dii.data)

loanbook_demo
#> # A tibble: 320 x 19
#>    id_loan id_direct_loant… name_direct_loa… id_intermediate… name_intermedia…

matched <- match_name(loanbook_demo, ald_demo)
matched
#> # A tibble: 502 x 27
#>    id_loan id_direct_loant… name_direct_loa… id_intermediate… name_intermedia…
#>    <chr>   <chr>            <chr>            <chr>            <chr>

Next you should validate the matched data (learn how).

Finally, prioritize() takes matched data and picks rows of highest priority.

prioritize(matched)
#> # A tibble: 267 x 27
#>    id_loan id_direct_loant… name_direct_loa… id_intermediate… name_intermedia…
#>    <chr>   <chr>            <chr>            <chr>            <chr>

We look forward to your feedback.
